sections.purpose: To provide high-temperature, uniform heating for reaction vessels using sand.
sections.scope: Applicable to chemical reactions in Pharmaceutical Analysis.
procedure: Fill the bath container with clean, dry sand.
Place the container on a hot plate and set the required temperature.
Embed the reaction flask into the sand to ensure uniform contact.
Monitor the temperature using a thermometer placed in the sand.
Turn OFF the heat after the process and allow it to cool.
Carefully remove the flask and wipe off any adhering sand.
Store the sand bath in a dry location after use.
precautions: Ensure the sand is completely dry to avoid splattering.
Use heat-resistant gloves when handling the hot bath.
Do not touch the hot sand with bare hands.
Keep the hot plate electrical cord away from the heated bath.
Ensure the sand is free from chemical contaminants.
